title: Riot, can you make a mechanically hard tank champion?
body:
I was joking around with my friend about his complete lack of mechanics when he brings up a fair point. Riot really hasn't made very many mechanically hard juggernaut/tank champions. Most of the really hard champs, Azir, Kalista, etc. are usually in the carry roles, or are carry type top lanes

Most juggernaut champions tend to be brainless hunks of meat that run in and disrupt the enemy team before they die. But it would be kind of interesting to see a tanky champion who actually requires a lot of skill to play.

EDIT: I know a lot of you guys have mentioned champs that take particular skill in certain areas (Energy management, decision making, etc.) What I think the tank class is missing is a champion that has a really high skill cap in terms of simply champion mechanics. No one out there is going to say Shen is harder than Zed, or Tahm Kench is harder than Kalista.

The only suggestions that I really agree with on the list is probably {{champion:150}}. The others may be hard to master, but not necessarily difficult to play decently well.

{{champion:154}} Zac is pretty mechanical dude.
You have to land that knockup on as many people as possible, which is actually pretty hard.
You have to move around during your ult, making sure to knock people in the CORRECT direction and slow the correct targets.
You have to repeatedly pick up your blobs, which is almost like Draven axes but without the time limit, and make sure opponents don't crush them.
You have to make sure to use W right when it's up, since the cooldown fluctuates.
You have to land your Q to slow as many people as possible.

{{champion:150}} Gnar as well.
His rage mechanic is difficult to manage.
Landing the boomerang over and over is hard, and kiting using your W passive.
Mega Gnar requires clutch ult timing and positioning, and using your W and Q on as many targets as possible, and catching stragglers with Q.

Surprised nobody's mentioned {{champion:14}} .   

You can literally miss all of his moves.   And chaining them together can be tough, especially with the change to his W, and the fact that any CC knocks him out of his Q.  I find him to be quite difficult.

Being able to miss your attacks does not make a champ complex. His Q, E and R are fundamentally simple: You attack whatever is directly in front of you / line shot. His W pops in a point blank AoE. That's it.

Take for example Rumble: You have to be mindful of overheating, and your ult requires you to aim your missiles in a spot where you feel the enemy will have no choice but to stand in it for longer than a second, otherwise they won't take much damage from it.

Fiora: You have to aim your attacks and lounge at an enemy champion's vital spot, which requires precise positioning. W requires you to predict oncoming attacks (and cc) to be most effective, all while aiming it at the opponent(s) intended direction 0.75 seconds later.

Azir: You have to keep tabs on your soldiers and enemy positions to ensure your Q strikes, and to ensure your E will collide with an enemy - both have high chances of missing as well, but are not simple skill shots like Sion's abilities. His ult makes you decide between juggling enemies against other terrain, comboing with his other abilities to get behind the opponent and shove them into your team/away from their team, or using it simply to peel.

I find Sion's attacks easiest to chain together when unseen from within the brush, after ulting onto someone, or if I have an ally that locks enemies in place first. I only feel smart playing him when I figure out a way to get in position. Otherwise I just ask myself, "do you see someone you can kill? Then go kill em." Not mechanically complex IMO.
I wouldn't call him MECHANICALLY difficult, besides his ult, but he does require a lot of thinking and planning.

It would be more like if they gave thresh double actives on every ability, and each of those were wildly different. I don't know.

>Most of those are more decision making and less mechanics involved though.

But isn't that what tanks are for? o.O

Tanks are more strategic in the big picture, they're more reliant on their team as a part of it. Granted, you should be making good decisions with glass cannons (we *all* know that one guy who *tried* to 1v5), but tanks know when to initiate fights so their carries 1.) know to follow up and 2.) don't die in the process.

How can we make a tank reliant on mechanics without either making them too powerful (being able to solo carry games), being overly mobile, or difficult for the sake of being difficult (and thus, overshadowed by simpler tanks who can do the same job)?

I'd be interested in seeing what Riot could come up with for a mechanically complex tank. It would be no small task (making one just for the lulz wouldn't be so great, so there'd have to be some legitimate reason the champion is hard to pull off), but I feel like there could be space for at least one or two.

Just gonna rehash some points I'm seeing people make.

All true tanks are really mechanically simple, big aoe abilities and easier to land skills, it's to give them reliability, it's the decision making that (which is a legit skill but bit what op is talking about) that makes the standard tank challenging to play.

It'd be difficult to make a mechanically difficult, true tank/mainly because they're often slow and beefy as hell to compensate, this makes them very forgiving of misplays and poor positioning/targeting, so you can't make a tank that can be punished for bad play the same way azir or yasuo could.

My solution? Either A tank who has abilities that interact with both opponents and allies like bards E and R, if tanks can't have flashy difficult mechanics like azir drifts or flash ult insec plays, then you can add the difficulty in their decision making by making their spells have either win teamfights or fuck up your team.  Maybe a champion who creates terrain and stuff.

Or maybe they just got to try and make a pure tank/juggernaut who doesn't directly get durable, but has ways of tanking aggro through deception or something, like a juggernaut shaco, where he's not directly tanky and he's slow, but there's a bunch of him coming from all directions and the only way to know he's not coming is to focus down all of them.

Just some thoughts I'll keep brain storming in ways to make a mechanically complex tank/juggernaut
